intro: Ceropegia anantii, commonly known as the Cape ceropegia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its trailing stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are usually pale green or yellowish, with a unique structure that attracts specific pollinators. Ceropegia anantii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and resilience in dry conditions.
